items.title: Stock Market LIVE Updates: GIFT Nifty indicates a negative start; US markets mixed, Asia falls
items.description: Sensex Today | Stock Market LIVE Updates: Treasury yields and the dollar fell while the Dow registered a record closing high on Friday as a subdued U.S. inflation report lifted expectations of an outsized interest rate cut at the Federal Reserve's November policy meeting. The Dow Jones Industrial Average rose 137.89 points, or 0.33%, to 42,313.00, the S&P 500 fell 7.20 points, or 0.13%, to 5,738.17 and the Nasdaq Composite fell 70.70 points, or 0.39%, to 18,119.59.

items.title: First Tick: Top 10 global cues for todayâ€™s trade
items.description: The GIFT Nifty is indicating a negative start for the day.

items.title: Will Nifty see further consolidation or end Sept on a high? BSE, BEL, Trent in focus | Opening Bell
items.description: Benchmark indices Sensex and Nifty snapped 6-day winning streak and ended lower in the last trading session. However, they managed to extend weekly gains for the third consecutive time backed by rally in largecaps. Today, September 30 will be the last trading day of the month and market participants will keenly watch whether benchmarks would end it on a high note or it will witness some consolidation. Experts charted out 26,400-26,500 as the next hurdle for further upside, with downside support of 26,000. This morning global cues are US markets ended last week on a positive note, with S&P 500 and Dow rising about 0.6 percent and NASDAQ Composite up nearly 1 percent. Asia-Pacific markets were also mixed this morning. Oil prices will also be keenly tracked after Israel's assassination of Hezbollah leader has further inflamed tensions in the Middle East. Among stocks in focus, watch out for BSE, Lupin, Biocon, Adani Energy, BEL, Trent, among others. Catch Lovisha Darad in conversation with Aamar Deo Singh-Sr Vice President, Angelone and Nikhil Oswalâ€”Founder & Director, Finterest Capital.

items.title: HSBC initiates coverage on Varun Beverages with 'buy' tag; sees 28% upside potential
items.description: HSBC sees potential in Varun Beverages to become the largest and most disruptive PepsiCo bottler in the company's history. The company is currently the second largest franchisee of PepsiCo outside the US.

items.title: Agri Picks Report September 30, 2024: Geojit Financial Services
items.description: According to Geojit, The water level in 155 key reservoirs of the country as of Thursday was 156.639 bcm, 87% of the total live storage capacity of 180.852 bcm, according to data from the Central Water Commission.

items.description: Zydus Lifesciences has received a significant approval from the US FDA for Enzalutamide capsules, which are used in treatment of metastatic castration-resistant prostate cancer.

items.title: September sees largest retail sell-off since march with net sales at Rs 7,500 crore
items.description: So far in September, retail investors have sold shares over Rs7,500 crore, marking the largest sell-off since March 2024. Meanwhile, domestic investors bought shares worth around Rs 17,421 crore while foreign investors bought Rs 55,855 crore worth of shares in September.

items.title: Chart of the day | How markets responded to the fed's interest rate cuts
items.description: In 12 months after previous Fed rate cuts, the market gained by an average of 11% when there was no recession and even during recessions it managed an average increase of 8%

items.title: LT Foods, KRBL surge 4% after govt slashes export duty on parboiled rice
items.description: By cutting export duties, India's export prices are expected to drop, boosting shipments and thereby revenues for rice exporters like LT Foods and KRBL.

items.title: PB Fintech stock jumps 3% after co clarifies healthcare plan, proposes one-time minority investment
items.description: PB Fintech shares jumped 3% to Rs 1,700 on September 30 after the company clarified plans for a one-time minority investment in a healthcare venture. Chairman Yashish Dahiya said the company intends to acquire a 20-30% stake for up to $100 million.

items.title: Cantabil Retail India: Demand to pick up from H2; valuations attractive
items.description: With roughly 550 stores now, CRIL has huge potential to expand. Moreover, CRIL is not present in South India now and aims to enter that market after two years, which indicates huge growth potential.

items.title: Stocks On Radar: Welspun Enterprises, Apollo Hospitals, Adani Enterprises & Tata Motors in focus
items.description: The market has snapped its six-day winning streak due to profit booking, with the Nifty 50 closing 37 points lower on September 27, the first day of the October series. However, the index maintained a higher highs-higher lows formation for another session, and volatility hit a fresh two-month low. As long as the index sustains above the 26,000-mark, reaching 26,500 cannot be ruled out in the upcoming sessions, especially after likely consolidation. The crucial support lies in the 25,900-25,800 zone, according to experts. Let's catch up on the latest news from the stock market. From significant investments to major deals, fund raising and appointments, hereâ€™s a quick look at which stocks will be in focus in today's trade. Watch here-

items.title: Stock Of The Day| Is there more steam left in the Home First Finance stock?
items.description: Home First is growing its loan book consistently, backed by buoyant demand from tier 2/3 cities and strong policy thrust. The AUM crossed the Rs 10,000-crore-mark, a key milestone, in the June quarter, and the company reiterated the AUM growth guidance of 30 percent. Affordable housing sector will be a key focus area of the government, and Home First will stand to benefit, given robust loan growth and stable asset quality.

items.description: Last week, brokerage firm UBS Securities also initiated a 'sell' call on Aurobindo Pharma, assigning it a price target of Rs 1,333, predicting a 12 percent downside.

items.description: Except metal and media (up 1 percent each), all other sectoral indices ended in the red with auto, bank, IT, telecom, pharma, and realty down 1-2 percent.

items.title: Gainers & losers: Stocks and sectors that moved the most on September 30
items.description: After opening on a weak footing, the selloff in the market accelerated during the last hour of trading, with the Sensex plunging over 1,200 points and Nifty dropping below the key 26,000 level, signaling heightened investor caution.
